title: From both-sidesism to backbone
description: Few institutions are singled out in the U.S. Constitution. The press is one of them. Given that the founders enshrined our industry in the First Amendment, you’d expect journalists to stand tall not just for our corner of the document, but for the full scope of what it protects. Instead, fear of appearing biased, a...
